titlestmt.titleproper: Markle Foundation records, Accessions 1997-2008, Record Group 4
A Guide to the Markle Foundation records, Accessions 1997-2008, Record Group 4 FA785

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-28 00:04:40 -0500.

did.unittitle: Markle Foundation records, Accessions 1997-2008, Record Group 4

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John and Mary R. Markle Foundation

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: John and Mary R. Markle Foundation

physdesc.extent: 84 document boxes and 133 record storage boxes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series 1: Administrative Files. Series 2: Grant and Grantee Files. Series 3: Henry Geller papers. Series 4: Financial records. Series 5: Lloyd N. Morrisett files. Series 6: Cathy Clark files. Series 7: Edith Bjornson files. Series 8: Accession 2000:016. Series 9: Accession 2008:073.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 15 years old are open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: RAC has legal title, copyright and literary rights to the collection in so far as it holds them. RAC may grant permission to publish material in the collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Records were donated to RAC by the Markle Foundation in 2008. The archival material was physically transferred in multipe accessions spanning 1997-2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Records include: Grant and Grantee files, correspondence, Board of Directors materials, Annual reports, and a small selection of building and office files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Administrative records are arranged in 7 subseries as follows: 1. Annual Reports. 2. Board of Directors Meeting Agendas. 3. Minutes. 4. Chronological Correspondence. 5. Former Board of Directors Minutes. 6. Building and Office Files. 7. Miscellaneous.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Henry Geller an attorney, law professor, and telecommunications advisor to the Markle Foundation has spent much of his career focused in the areas of telecommunications regulation and policymaking. Geller served the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) in various capacities for more than 20 years, including but not limited to serving as General Counsel in the mid-1960s and as an assistant to Dean Burch from 1969-1974 during Burch's chairmanship of the Commission. Geller also served as administrator of the National Telecommunications and Information Administration (NTIA) from 1978-1981.

physdesc.extent: Seven standard record storage boxes and one letter document box.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Lloyd N. Morrisett served as President of the Markle Foundation from 1969-1998.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. Access copy currently unavailable. Please consult a RAC archivist for further instruction.
